meanings.definition: A type of vegetable with a compact head of undeveloped white flower buds.
meanings.sent1: Cauliflowers grow in gardens and are harvested for their tasty heads.
meanings.sent2: I bought some fresh cauliflowers from the market to make a delicious stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: Why did the broccoli refuse to play hide-and-seek with the cauliflowers? Because they always stick out!
meanings.sent4: The cauliflower field looked like a sea of fluffy white clouds ready to be picked.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret to a perfect creamy soup is adding pureed cauliflowers for extra flavor.

meanings.definition: The edible white head of this vegetable.
meanings.sent1: After steaming, the cauliflowers were served with a drizzle of lemon butter.
meanings.sent2: She chopped the cauliflowers into florets to prepare a healthy salad.
meanings.sent3: The kids were amazed when the magician turned a cauliflower into a bouquet of flowers!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a cauliflower, full of ideas waiting to bloom into reality.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of roasted cauliflowers filled the kitchen, making everyone's mouth water.
